title: Exception Handling
concept: This level focuses on try–catch, multiple catch blocks, finally block, throwing exceptions manually with 'throw new', and custom exception classes. All questions are designed to work inside standard online compilers without real file I/O.

challenges.title: Handle Divide by Zero
challenges.description: Read a and b. Print a/b. If b = 0, catch exception and print 'Error'.

challenges.title: Multiple Catch Blocks
challenges.description: Read integer n. Print n*n. If input is invalid (ex: string input), catch and print 'Invalid'.

challenges.title: Array Index Exception
challenges.description: Read N then N elements in array, then index i. Print arr[i]. If index is invalid print 'Out of bounds'.

challenges.title: Finally Block Execution
challenges.description: Always print 'Done' in finally block after executing either normal result or Error.
challenges.examplesNote: Final output must be two lines only.

challenges.title: Throw Custom Error (Manual)
challenges.description: If number is negative, manually throw exception and print 'Negative'. Else print square.

challenges.title: User Defined Exception Class
challenges.description: Create class InvalidAgeException. If age < 18 throw exception and print 'Underage', else print 'Allowed'.

challenges.title: Null Exception Simulation
challenges.description: Read a string. If string is 'null' (exact text), simulate a NullPointerException and print 'Null'. Else print the length.

challenges.title: Number Format Validation
challenges.description: Read string input. Convert to integer. If not valid print 'Invalid Number'. Else print n*2.

challenges.title: Safe Average
challenges.description: Read N then N integers. If N == 0 print 'NA'. Else print average (int division).

challenges.title: Mini Exception Calculator
challenges.description: Perform + - * /. If division by zero → Error. If operator invalid → Invalid.
